title: Bengaluru rains: Bengaluru Airport faces water leakage amid heavy rainfall, disrupts operations of 17 flights - The Economic Times
text: Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) faced a challenge on May 9 as heavy rain caused water leakage at Terminal 2 (T2), leading to the diversion of multiple flights. Rainwater dripped from the roof near the baggage claim area of T2, prompting a swift response from Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL), which operates KIA. The incident occurred due to a very heavy downpour within a short span of time, causing inconvenience to passengers.Water Leakage at Terminal 2:The heavy rain on May 9 resulted in water leakage at certain areas of the terminals at Bengaluru airport. BIAL stated, A very heavy downpour of rain within a short span of time on the evening of May 9, 2024, resulted in water leakage in certain areas of the terminals at Bengaluru airport. Our teams promptly responded to the situation to mitigate the impact and restore normal operations. We regret the inconvenience caused to our passengers. Terminal 2 Background:The T2 of KIA was built at a cost of Rs 5,000 crore and was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on November 11, 2022. The terminal, which commenced domestic operations on January 15, 2023, saw its first bout of water leakage just months after its inauguration. International flight operations at T2 began on September 12.Weather and Traffic Conditions:Bengaluru airport recorded 72.4mm of rainfall, while the city received 14mm till 8:30 am on May 10, as per the India Meteorological Department. Waterlogging was reported on the roads leading to the airport, causing severe inconvenience to airport-bound passengers. Areas like Chalukya Circle to Hebbal flyover and Hunasamaranahalli experienced waterlogging, with traffic moving slowly. The Bengaluru traffic police advised commuters to expect a 30 to 40-minute delay to the airport.Flights Diverted:Several Bengaluru-bound flights were diverted to Chennai due to heavy rains. A total of 13 domestic flights, three international passenger flights, and one international cargo flight were affected. The airport became inaccessible for landings between 9:35 pm and 10:30 pm due to heavy rainfall and strong winds, according to a BIAL spokesperson. Heavy rainfall accompanied by strong winds rendered the airport inaccessible for landings between 9:35pm and 10:30pm, leading to the diversion of flights, a BIAL spokesperson said.According to the India Meteorological Department, Bengaluru airport recorded 72.4mm of rainfall, while Bengaluru City received 14mm, till 8:30am on May 10. Hunasamaranahalli (near IAF station) on KIA Airport Road is flooded. Heavy congestion due to slow-moving traffic on both sides... Commuters kindly cooperate... Commuters may expect a 30 to 40-minute delay to the airport, Bengaluru traffic police wrote in an advisory on X on May 9.Passengers are advised to check with airlines for updates on flight schedules in case of further disruptions due to weather conditions.
